Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the video by suggesting that it shows ballots for Trump being burned, when in fact they were sample ballots.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to back up the assertion that the ballots in the video are real.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the ballots in the video are genuine without verifying their authenticity.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by Virginia Beach officials, who confirmed that the ballots in the video were sample ballots and not real.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the ballots in the video were not real, as confirmed by Virginia Beach officials and local news outlets.
Understate: The claim understates the significance of the misinformation spread by the video, as it gained traction and was retweeted by Eric Trump, contributing to the spread of false information.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by suggesting that the video shows actual ballots being burned, even though it is later clarified that they were sample ballots.
